description: A Trips resource represents a set of flight search results, each of which contains multiple priced itineraries.

blocks.name: searchTrips
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of flights.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: Your ApiKey obtained from Google Developer Console.

args.name: fields
args.info: Optional: Selector specifying a subset of fields to include in the response. For more information, see the partial response documentation. Use for better performance..

args.name: quotaUser
args.info: Optional: Alternative to userIp. Lets you enforce per-user quotas from a server-side application even in cases when the user's IP address is unknown. This can occur, for example, with applications that run cron jobs on App Engine on a user's behalf. You can choose any arbitrary string that uniquely identifies a user, but it is limited to 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided. Learn more about capping usage.

args.name: userIp
args.info: Optional: IP address of the end user for whom the API call is being made. Lets you enforce per-user quotas when calling the API from a server-side application. Learn more about capping usage.

args.name: passengersKind
args.info: Required: Identifies this as a passenger count object, representing the number of passengers. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#passengerCounts.

args.name: passengersAdultCount
args.info: Required: The number of passengers that are adults.

args.name: passengersChildCount
args.info: Required: The number of passengers that are children.

args.name: passengersInfantInLapCount
args.info: Required: The number of passengers that are infants travelling in the lap of an adult.

args.name: passengersInfantInSeatCount
args.info: Required: The number of passengers that are infants each assigned a seat.

args.name: passengersSeniorCount
args.info: Required: The number of passengers that are senior citizens.

args.name: slices
args.info: Required: Array of json. The slices that make up the itinerary of this trip. A slice represents a traveler's intent, the portion of a low-fare search corresponding to a traveler's request to get between two points. One-way journeys are generally expressed using one slice, round-trips using two. An example of a three slice trip would be: BOS-LAX 10MAR2007, LAX-SYD 17MAR2007, SYD-BOS 22MAR2007. However, if this traveler were just stopping in LAX and SYD to change planes, this would likely be a three segment, one slice trip. Example: [{"kind": "qpxexpress#sliceInput","origin": "BOS","destination": "LAX","date": "2017-10-10"},{"kind": "qpxexpress#sliceInput","origin": "LAX","destination": "BOS","date": "2017-10-15"}]

args.name: maxPrice
args.info: Optional: Do not return solutions that cost more than this price. The currency is specified in ISO-4217. The format, in regex, is [A-Z] {3} \d+(\.\d+)?

args.name: saleCountry
args.info: Required: IATA country code representing the point of sale. This determines the "equivalent amount paid" currency for the ticket.

args.name: ticketingCountry
args.info: Required: IATA country code representing the point of ticketing.

args.name: refundable
args.info: Optional: Return only solutions with refundable fares.

args.name: solutions
args.info: Optional: The number of solutions to return, maximum 500.
